quotes.quote: Respect for ourselves guides our morals, respect for others guides our manners.
I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university.
If you want to be respected by others, the great thing is to respect yourself. Only by that, only by self-respect will you compel others to respect you.
That you may retain your self-respect, it is better to displease the people by doing what you know is right, than to temporarily please them by doing what you know is wrong.
Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
He that respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
If we lose our love and self-respect and respect for each other, this is how we will finally die.
Respect commands itself and it can neither be given nor withheld when it is due.
Respect is an invention of people who want to cover up the empty place where love should be.
This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
Tolerance implies a respect for another person, not because he is wrong or even because he is right, but because he is human.
If men are to resect each other for what they are, they must cease to respect each other for what they own.
You can demand courtesy but you have to earn respect.
If we can respect the divine within us, if we can treat it with dignity, then we can respect others around us.
Respect begins with this attitude: I acknowledge that you are a creature of extreme worth.
People crave for more respect than love, because they expect love only from few people but they want respect from everyone.
Respect at the cost of others is disrespect in effect.
When we love and respect people, revealing to them their value, they can begin to come out from behind the walls that protect them.
The only true disability is the inability to accept and respect differences.
When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
It is not grey hair that makes one respectable but character.
Respect depends on reciprocity.
When we show our respect for other living things, they respond with respect for us.
Deal with yourself as an individual worthy of respect and make everyone else deal with you the same way.
A man's respect for law and order exists in precise relationship to the size of his paycheck.
Mutual respect is the foundation of genuine harmony.
The gentle and respectful ways of saying 'To hell with you' are being abandoned.
The only way to teach respect is to model it.
I'm not concerned with your liking or disliking me. All I ask is that you respect me as a human being.
We must have respect for both plumbers and our philosophers, or neither our pipes or our theories will hold water.
